events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred downtown involving a collision with another vehicle.
The claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' after reviewing the initial report and damage description.
An agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and coordinate further actions.
The customer received an acknowledgement of their auto accident claim, confirming it is now under review.
The insurance company requested the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including police report and repair invoices promptly.
The claims department began investigating the circumstances of the vehicle collision as per protocol.
Investigation concluded confirming liability and damage details consistent with the customer's account.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental vehicle reimbursement was formally proposed to the claimant.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement terms and efficiency.
The claim was approved officially after agreement on settlement, initiating the payout process.
Payment for vehicle repairs and related expenses was issued to the claimant without delay.
The claim case was closed successfully after full settlement payment and confirmation with the customer.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived for record-keeping and future reference.
